message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GR, cs.CV, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of simplifying polygonal curves, which is a fundamental problem in computational geometry. The problem involves reducing the number of vertices in a curve while preserving its shape. This is a classic problem in computational geometry and falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also presents an approximation algorithm, which involves computing a curve that is at most twice the minimum possible. This suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of approximation algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also deals with the problem of directed Hausdorff distance, which is a measure of similarity between two curves. This suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of geometric reasoning (cs.GR). The paper also deals with the problem of curve-restricted simplification, which involves placing the vertices of the simplified curve on any point of the input curve. This suggests that the paper may also fall under the category of computer vision (cs.CV) or signal processing (cs.SI).
